title: Fundamentals of the Southern African Assembly
summary: Level 1 introduces the lawful foundations of the Southern African Assembly (TSAA): the mission, principles of sovereignty, Common Law, and self-governance.

questions.question: What is the primary mission of the Southern African Assembly (TSAA)?
options: To reconstruct lawful self-governance under Common Law

questions.question: What does TSAA help individuals correct?
options: Their political status and lawful identity

questions.question: Which law does TSAA operate under?
Why is 'status correction' important in TSAA teachings?
options: It reclaims lawful standing as a living man or woman on the land

questions.question: Which phrase reflects TSAA’s guiding ethos?
What type of organization is TSAA?
options: A lawful unincorporated assembly of living people

questions.question: What does personal sovereignty mean under Common Law?
options: Self-governance and responsibility under Natural Law

questions.question: What knowledge does TSAA promote?
Which three jurisdictions exist on Earth?
TSAA identifies its members as:
options: Living men and women of the land

questions.question: Common Law is based on which core idea?
options: Do no harm, cause no loss, keep the peace

questions.question: Under Natural Law, who holds final authority over a man or woman?
options: Their conscience guided by divine law

questions.question: Why is consent vital in lawful dealings?

questions.question: What does registration often do under corporate law?
options: Transfers ownership or control to another entity

questions.question: Why should lawful documents be autographed rather than signed?
options: An autograph represents the living being; a signature represents a corporate agent

questions.question: What is the Assembly’s primary duty?
options: To keep the peace and uphold Public Law

questions.question: What is the true purpose of lawful government?
options: To protect rights, property, and peace

questions.question: According to Natural Law, all people are:
options: Equal in rights and responsibility under creation

questions.question: Why must lawful notice be given before enforcement?
options: Because no one can be held to a law they have not been informed of

questions.question: Which phrase best describes lawful living?
options: Do no harm, cause no loss, keep the peace
